meanings.sent1: The recalcitrant student refused to follow the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The cat was being recalcitrant and wouldn't come inside when called.
meanings.sent3: The recalcitrant alarm clock decided to stay silent in protest.
meanings.sent4: The old car's recalcitrant engine sputtered and refused to start.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrant storm clouds blocked out the sun, defying the weather forecast.

meanings.definition: Stubbornly resistant to authority or control
meanings.sent1: Her recalcitrant attitude made it difficult for her to work with others.
meanings.sent2: The recalcitrant child refused to listen to his parents' instructions.
meanings.sent3: The recalcitrant computer kept crashing just to annoy its user.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrant weeds in the garden seemed to thrive despite efforts to remove them.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrant stain on the carpet resisted all cleaning attempts, becoming a permanent mark.

meanings.sent1: The recalcitrant horse refused to be saddled, causing delays.
meanings.sent2: The recalcitrant employee ignored the company's rules and regulations.
meanings.sent3: The recalcitrant pen ran out of ink just when it was needed most.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrant toddler threw a tantrum in the store, much to the embarrassment of the parents.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrant lock on the door jammed, preventing entry into the room.
